intro: Coris monspeliensis subsp. annua, commonly known as the annual form of the common coris, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. It is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Boraginaceae family.
